content:

Thanks tcooke!

where's code here?

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Re-approving this puzzle :)

Hey CodinGamer! Your contribution has unfortunately not been moderated on time and will temporarily be removed from the system... But no worries! You can republish it anytime to give it another chance! :)
I am not sure how to Approve the puzzle, I did upvote it, but I cannot find how to add myself as approver, maybe I am not currently of a enough high level (18).
Good job

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Great job.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple combinatorics / enumeration puzzle :)

How many parts will there be? What will the subsequent part(s) be about?

Goal
* Please change "two player's" to "two players'".

* Please add the following sentence in the paragraph before the example:
Only configurations where both Ls can be placed on the board simultaneously should be counted.

* Please add the following paragraph before the example:

In any configuration, even if the Ls occupy the same positions on the board, the color of the Ls matters. Thus, configurations where the Ls are in the same locations but differ in color (red vs. blue) are considered distinct configurations. On the other hand, having different blockers in the same locations would not be considered different, because they are considered identical.

* Please change "both of the player's" to "both players'".

* "Add picture here..." placeholders pending update.

* Please remove the last sentence from the last paragraph.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement.

Cover picture
* Consider adding a cover picture for the puzzle.

Thanks.

Thanks for the detailed feedback.
I've made most of the changes you suggested. I did not use your suggested paragraph exactly, as I felt that it implied the Ls could overlap their positions.

I intend to do a second puzzle on solving the L-game at some point, but for the moment I've removed the Part I from the title.

I intend to add a cover picture at some point, but it may be a while before I get to the graphics.
I think you need to be Level 20 to approve. But thanks for trying.
I'm not sure why you can't see any code. Maybe it isn't shown until you reach some Level?
Could you please write a proper approval reason?

Thanks for updating the puzzle! Your revised wording works and definitely avoids the possible misinterpretation that my suggested wording might bring. Noted also on your explanation about the parts.

Just to recap the two outstanding points:
* 3 placeholders for pictures
* cover picture for the puzzle

In case you aren't aware, you cannot embed pictures in the statement; you can either include links to pictures or include an ASCII representation of the pictures (board configurations).

Aha. Thanks for the info about the pictures. I was sure I had seen graphical pictures in problem statements before (e.g. the medium tetrasticks packing puzzle I did last week) but had not realized that this was an exception, not the rule. I've added some ASCII pictures, and tweaked some of the wording/spacing.

Just need the cover picture now. I'll think about that for tomorrow.
Yup, pictures are available only for puzzles with the viewer enabled, because the author can and has to upload the required resources, including the statement in HTML format and any image files.
OK. I have no great artistic ability, but I now have a cover picture. I've now moved the problem out of WIP. Fingers crossed...
